DataElement.preferredName: Special Need Adult Patient Refuse Therapy Assessment Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Surpassing what is common or usual or expected._Anything that is necessary but lacking; the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior._A human who has reached reproductive age._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._the free text field to specify the assessment performed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Surpassing what is common or usual or expected.:Anything that is necessary but lacking; the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior.:A human who has reached reproductive age.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: Surpassing what is common or usual or expected.

Anything that is necessary but lacking; the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior.
An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field to specify the assessment performed.
